page.title: 15A CAMEO OF BEXHILL OLD TOWN
page.content: The original village is a cluster of old cottages and{Georgian houses grouped around the parish church.{King {Offa}gave the land to the{church}in {772.}A{Saxon stone}carving in{St. {Peter's}dates from this time. Other notable things are a Crusader's coffin and some{14th century stained glass. } {Church St. contains a medieval {wealden house}now used as a tea-room. The Bell Inn was once a{smuggler's haunt. Pocock, the butchers, has been in High St. since{1803. Barrack Rd.}is named after the place where the king's German troops were stationed at that time. The Walnut Tree cafe recalls an old tree which stood in the village centre until recent times.{The Manor {House ruins,}now an attractive gardens area, were opened by{Princess {Alexandra in 1972,}the year of the {900th aniversary pageant of Bexhill.}
